reviewText: Having a son in the Army, this show hits close to home!  My daughter-in-law and I discuss each episode and also try to figure out the up coming episodes! It is about as true to life as entertainment can allow! I think it is one of the best shows on TV today.  They had talked of canceling the show but apparently the "fans" of the show wouldn't hold still for that! One finds themselves feeling like a member of the family in this show. You laugh, cry, worry, do all the things with them that any military family does. If anyone wants to have a glimpse of military life, this is a great way to experience it for yourself!  Thanks to my son and his wife, I now own every season of "Army Wives"!  It was my Christmas present amd I couldn't have wished for anything better! I don't know what else to say about "Army Wives" but that, to me, it is the best show out there at this time.It shows life on the Army base called Ft. Marshall! There are 5 families, each with the military person a different rank from general down to Sgt. There is even a female LT.Col. The whole series is mainly about the close friendships one forms while going through the different experiences that military families go through  during tours of duty at different posts! Like I said if one wants to get even an idea of military life, watch "Army Wives"!

reviewText: This series is well-cast, well-written, beautifully acted, and perfect in almost every way. The stories and the characters are so real that I feel as if I know them personally. They are not perfect, just human, and quite likable in their joys, sorrows, frustrations, troubles, and moments of triumph. I am often moved to tears or laughter as I watch the development of these characters and the story. Excellent. I recommend it for anyone who loves their country and wonders what it must be like for the soldiers and their families in the military forces.
